programme.title: The Skill Code
programme.desc: Cameron McCormick seeks to end all fear that players encounter when faced with a bunker shot. McCormick offers his fundamental concepts to thrive in the sand by demonstrating techniques related to setup, clubhead entry, trajectory, and spin control.

programme.title: The Skill Code
programme.desc: According to Cameron McCormick, players of every ability can suffer from the greenside yips, luckily McCormick offers a prescription to remedy the most prevalent symptom of the yips: lost confidence.

programme.title: The Skill Code
programme.sub-title: RX - Ball Striking and Amplifying Practice
programme.desc: Cameron McCormick shares the pillars of a successful and time efficient practice session. The 2015 PGA Teacher of the Year explains how gamifying practice can provide feedback while simulating the pressures and challenges of a competitive round.

programme.title: The Skill Code
programme.desc: Cameron McCormick explains why the best players in the world spend a large portion of their practice time around the green. McCormick demonstrates four practice session games designed to emphasize fundamentals.

programme.title: The Skill Code
programme.desc: Cameron McCormick provides a prescription to create more structure during putting practice sessions. McCormick shares four practice games, which are designed to hone aim and accuracy, develop better speed control and avoid three putts.

programme.title: The Skill Code
programme.desc: Cameron McCormick uses a series of skill-based games to demonstrate how becoming more adept at distance control and trajectory can create consistency in performance.

programme.title: Golf Channel Academy
programme.desc: Jimmy Walker shares tips that helped him become a major champion, specializing on and around the green. Jimmy discusses the keys to greenside bunker play, teaches how to chip it close with the wedge, and reveals how an alignment rod helps sink putts.

programme.title: Golf Channel Academy
programme.desc: Major champion Jimmy Walker breaks down all things full swing to show what has led him to multiple victories on the PGA TOUR. He highlights the trials, tribulations, and ultimately the rewards of implementing major swing changes.

programme.title: Golf Channel Academy
programme.desc: Jimmy Walker talks all aspects of distance, bringing out the driver to show how to gain distance off the tee and how to tone it down.

programme.title: Golf Channel Academy
programme.desc: Juli Inkster shares her best full swing tips. Inkster talks about the best way to warm up, how to groove your swing for more consistency, and how to hit more fairways with the driver. Inkster talks ball position fundamentals.

programme.title: Golf Channel Academy
programme.desc: The 2017 Solheim Cup Captain, Juli Inkster shares her best short game tips. Inkster also demos how to chip effectively from the fairway and the bunker. Learn the fundamentals of ball position, how to shape your irons, and other helpful drills.

programme.title: Golf Channel Academy
programme.desc: The 2017 Solheim Cup Captain, Juli Inkster shares her best short game tips. Inkster also demos how to chip effectively from the fairway and the bunker. Learn the fundamentals of ball position, how to shape your irons, and other helpful drills.

programme.title: Golf Channel Academy
programme.desc: Juli Inkster, 2017 Solheim Cup Captain, shares her top putting secrets and fundamentals to make the greens easier.

programme.title: Golf Channel Academy
programme.desc: Trevor Immelman, 2008 Masters champion, offers tips on putting instruction he learned from golf legends, Gary Player, Ernie Els,and Retief Goosen.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Learn how to build a practice station for improving start line, an easy guide to green reading and tips for better speed control used by 2023 Masters Champion Jon Rahm.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Learn a Ben Hogan tip for improving a backswing, how an alignment stick can cure a transition faults and a creative drill using maracas to shake up a downswing sequence.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Devan Bonebrake covers the biggest keys and teaches his favorite drills for getting up and down from greenside bunkers.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Devan Bonebrake teaches how to develop a go-to shot that will help to play under pressure like a Major Champion; learn how to hit power fades like Jon Rahm, high draws like Rory McIlroy and low stingers like Tiger Woods.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Learn how a water bottle will help to stop scooping pitch shots, how a slip and slide will help on downhill lies and how a fairway wood will help players scramble like Tiger Woods.

programme.title: Playing Lessons
programme.desc: Sean Foley plays alongside LPGA Tour star Pernilla Lindberg to discuss her strategies and techniques that work for her on the big stage.

programme.title: Playing Lessons
programme.desc: PGA Tour winner Cameron Champ shows how he goes about playing the game, takes on a drivable par-4 and explains how he is able to use distance as a weapon and a strategy.

programme.title: Playing Lessons
programme.desc: Masters champion Danny Willett goes in-depth on accounting for wind, adjusting play from a divot or behind a tree, and going for a par-5 from the fairway as opposed to a fairway bunker.

programme.title: Playing Lessons
programme.desc: Jon Rahm shows how he uses his supreme power and touch around the greens to go low on the course. Rahm goes in depth to show how to strategically break down long putts into segments for an accurate read.

programme.title: Playing Lessons
programme.desc: 2018 NCAA Individual Champion, Jennifer Kupcho, discusses preparations for the 2019 NCAA Women's Golf Championships and her LPGA debut as a professional.

programme.title: Playing Lessons
programme.desc: Multiple-time PGA Tour winner Pat Perez shows how to still score low while not hitting the long ball. Additionally, Perez goes in depth to show how important it is to get your eyes at the right angle to see the line in putting.

programme.title: Playing Lessons
programme.desc: Collin Morikawa joins Jim "Bones" Mackay on the course to show how he thinks his way around the links.

programme.title: Playing Lessons
programme.desc: PGA Tour standout Wyndham Clark goes in depth with his on-course strategies. Wyndham gives insight into how he plays par 5's aggressively and shows unique viewpoints on when it is worth it to lay-up on par 3's.

programme.title: Playing Lessons
programme.desc: Multiple time PGA Tour winner James Hahn braves a windy day and displays how his on-course strategy changes when dealing with the elements. Hahn explains the different adjustments to make depending on the direction of the wind.

programme.title: Playing Lessons
programme.desc: Ladies European Tour winner Anne van Dam demonstrates how her golf swing plays to her advantage with length and accuracy.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: One bad decision could mean elimination on the first day of competition.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: LPGA player Yani Tseng is the ultimate ringer, and a major twist turns the competition upside down.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: Just three days into the competition, energy and points are running low for some players, and the consequences could be devastating.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.sub-title: Time and Tide Wait for No One
programme.desc: It's a race to win immunity in a challenge where slow play is the ultimate penalty.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: Another twist in the points race leaves some competitors haunted by past decisions, and surprise guest LPGA player Gerina Pillar makes life difficult for those remaining.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.sub-title: Between the Devil and the Deep Blue Sea
programme.desc: With decision making at a premium, once again, one choice threatens to turn the competition onto an entirely different track.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: The value of Championship Points becomes even more apparent as one competitor will only get one shot to save herself.
